source.9c515c50:
colors = ['blue','green']
val = (df['Churn'].value_counts()*100.0 /len(df)).plot(kind='bar', stacked = True, rot = 0,color = colors)
val.yaxis.set_major_formatter(mtick.PercentFormatter())
val.set_ylabel('% Customers')
val.set_xlabel('Churn')
val.set_title('Churn Distribution')

totals = []

for i in val.patches:
    totals.append(i.get_width())

total = sum(totals)

for i in val.patches:
    val.text(i.get_x()+.05, i.get_height()-5, \
            str(round((i.get_height()/total), 1))+'%',
            fontsize=14,
            color='white',
           weight = 'bold')

source.12a3a33e:
colors = ['blue','green']
senior_churn = df.groupby(['SeniorCitizen','Churn']).size().unstack()

val = (senior_churn.T*100.0 / senior_churn.T.sum()).T.plot(kind='bar', width = 0.2,stacked = True, rot = 0,  figsize = (8,6),color = colors)
val.yaxis.set_major_formatter(mtick.PercentFormatter())
val.legend(loc='center',prop={'size':14},title = 'Churn')
val.set_ylabel('% Customers')
val.set_title('Churn by Seniority Level',size = 14)

for i in val.patches:
    width, height = i.get_width(), i.get_height()
    x, y = i.get_xy() 
    val.annotate('{:.0f}%'.format(height), (i.get_x()+.25*width, i.get_y()+.4*height),
                color = 'white',
               weight = 'bold',size =14)
source.7991d2c2:
fig, (ax1,ax2,ax3) = plt.subplots(nrows=1, ncols=3, sharey = True, figsize = (20,10))

ax = sns.distplot(df[df['Contract']=='Month-to-month']['tenure'],
                   hist=True,kde=False, ax=ax1)
ax.set_ylabel('# of Customers')
ax.set_xlabel('months')
ax.set_title('Month to Month Contract')

ax = sns.distplot(df[df['Contract']=='One year']['tenure'],
                   hist=True, kde=False,ax=ax2)
ax.set_xlabel('months',size = 14)
ax.set_title('One Year Contract',size = 14)

ax = sns.distplot(df[df['Contract']=='Two year']['tenure'],
                   hist=True, kde=False,ax=ax3)

ax.set_xlabel('months')
ax.set_title('Two Year Contract')

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.model_selection import GridSearchCV

X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(
    X, y, test_size=0.3, random_state=0)
    
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

sc = StandardScaler()
sc.fit(X_train)
X_train_std = sc.transform(X_train)
X_test_std = sc.transform(X_test)

from sklearn.metrics import roc_curve
from sklearn.metrics import roc_auc_score
source.f327d02c:
def plot_roc_curve(fpr, tpr):
    plt.plot(fpr, tpr, color='orange', label='ROC')
    plt.plot([0, 1], [0, 1], color='darkblue', linestyle='--')
    plt.xlabel('False Positive Rate')
    plt.ylabel('True Positive Rate')
    plt.title('Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) Curve')
    plt.legend()
    plt.show()

probs = lr.predict_proba(X_test_std)
probs=probs[:,1]
auc = roc_auc_score(y_test, probs)
print('AUC: %.2f' % auc)
fpr, tpr, thresholds = roc_curve(y_test, probs)
plot_roc_curve(fpr, tpr)

source.305b57b4:
About half of the customers in our data set are male while the other half are female.
And the distribution of churn is also almost equal in both the genders.
source.255faae1: The Logistic Regression model shows that customer with higher total charge, month-to-month contract and customers with fiber optic internet services are more likely group to churn than rest of the customers. On the contrast, customers with longer tenure, two-year contract, non-senior citizens, less monthly charges and who do not have multiple lines are least likely to churn.
source.4020db58: #### Churn rate is higher in customers who don't have dependents
source.edb659c7:
a) Most of the monthly contracts last for 1-2 months
b) The two-year contracts tend to last for about 70 months

This depicts that the customers taking a longer contract are more loyal to the company and tend to stay with it for a longer period of time. This is also what we saw in the earlier chart on correlation with the churn rate.
source.253d4fa2:
Month-to-month contract,no OnlineSecurity and No TechSupport are positively correlated with Churn.
Whereas Tenure, Two year contract type are negatively correlated with Churn 
All services such as Online security, streaming TV, online backup, tech support, etc. without internet connection seem to be negatively related to churn.
source.b446f2b9:
Among contract type the churn rate is higher for month to month contract customers.
For month to month contract the churn rate is 42%, for one year the churn rate is 11% and for two-year the churn rate is 2%.
source.7a224b9f:
There are only 16% of the customers who are senior citizens. Thus, most of our customers in the data are younger people.
But when we look at the churn rate, senior citizen has higher percentage of churn rate as compared to the younger customers. 
Senior Citizens have almost double 42% of churn rate than younger population having churn rate of 24%
source.b0d1b7b0: Churn rate is higher for customers having no partners
source.c0bc5a4c:
Among customers who have partner, half of them also have a dependent, while other half do not have any dependents. 
Among the customers who do not have any partner, a majority of them also do not have any dependents
source.07795742: Churn rate is higher for paperless billing method
source.dc7d9119: After comparing the results, XGBoost seems a better choice to predict customer churn. However, in terms of the cost of training the models, Gradient Boosting will require significantly longer time to train the algorithm as compared to Logistic Regression model. The sample dataset is only 7,000 rows but if the dataset grows larger, it will cost a lot of time to train the model. Also, from the logistic regression, we can easily understand the most important predictor variables which are contributing to the model in predicting the churn. Therefore, considering model performance, training cost and interpretation ability, Logistic Regression is selected as the best model for Telco churn prediction analysis.
source.8414a1bc: Looking at the distribution of the target variable, it can be found that 74% records for non-churn customers and 26 % of records are for churn customers.
source.b99ea273:
By looking at contract type, we can see from the graph that most of the customers are in month to month contract.
While there are equal number of customers in the one year and two-year contracts.
